page.title: 12BULMERS ORCHARD - WICHENFORD
page.content: {Bulmers}first crop, in Wichenford was harvested in{1972,}producing{3 tons. Four years later machine picking was introduced, and by{1982 a record crop {of 6953 tons}was harvested. Each ton produces{150 gallons}of cider. {Machines}pick from early September to December with hand pickers covering the grass slopes. The{Wichenford orchards}employ 10 full time staff and 4 casuals, working from 7.15 am to 4.15 pm daily. Care must be taken for{bruising}and insect control. Readiness for picking is tested by the {dark pips}and a minimum{10% sugar.}The cider apple has{high tannin content and is therefore sharp flavoured. The{474 acres}at Wichenford are Bulmers largest orchard, with 13 tractors on site. The apples are processed in the{Hereford plant.
